name: Clockwork Weaving Spider
description: A tiny construct with intricate clockwork design, resembling a mechanical spider. It possesses sharp blades and needles for attacks, exhibiting exceptional mobility.
memorable: Its ability to damage nonmagical items and paralyze targets makes it a unique threat in combat.
goals: To engage in combat and disable or ruin opponents' equipment.
relations: May be found among construct or machinery-related creatures or serve trap makers.
environment: Typically encountered in mechanical environments or as guardians of valuable items.
strengths: Immunity to poison, psychic damage, and various conditions such as paralysis or charm effects.
weaknesses: Low Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores limit its understanding and interaction capabilities.
attacks: Uses Trimming Blade for slashing damage and Poisoned Needle Shuttle for ranged piercing damage with a paralyzing effect.
most_powerful_ability: The 'Unmaking' ability allows it to damage nonmagical items, making it a strategic combatant.
senses: Has darkvision up to 60 feet and a passive perception of 13.
skills: Proficient in Acrobatics with a +5 modifier, making it highly agile.
additional_information: Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.
Immune to effects that alter its form.
Advantage on saving throws against spells.
Can execute multiple attacks in one turn.
Fast and able to evade attacks due to high Dexterity.
test_queries: tiny construct with paralyzing needle attacks
clockwork spider immune to charm effects
agile spider that doesn't need food or sleep
nimble clockwork construct hiding in machinery
